content.description:
Pitch 1: Short but fun sport pitch.  Start at the base of the large crack/chimney, clip the first bolt and traverse left onto the face.  follow the grove up until it is possible to exit out right and to the anchors

Pitch 2: Climb up the shallow corner above the anchor (gear) to the first bolt.  Follow 3 bolts up and left on some killer crimps up the just over vert face.  Traverse the crack out right (gear) until it is possible to pull over onto the slab.  3 more bolts of slab that will make you feel like Icarus, shoes melting off with each step higher.
content.protection:
pitch 1: 5 draws and chain anchor

pitch 2: 00-3 master cams, offset 00/0 and 1/2 are useful
content.location: This is the first route you will see on the west face when you approach the wall.

content.description: Start up a chimney with optional gear (#3 cam) and move left onto face. Face protected by bolts plus gear in crack.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus gear (small cam or nut, plus optional #3 cam). Chain anchor, shared with Fool Value.
content.location: East side Eagle Grove Rock, just left of Jolly Rancher.

content.description: Small but savory!  A powerful first move to a jug starts you up a steeper than it looks face.  Cool moves between crimps and side pulls to a final move that will have you begging for more.

Start in the same crack as for Fool Value but traverse left in the crack system, with the crux being in the middle of the traverse as you move under Lollipop Lamb Chop. Solid hand jams, great protection options, and creative footwork come into play through the crux. Follow the crack all the way up to the chains at the top of Aguila where you can lower off.

*Not sure if we made the first ascent. There's no record here in Mountain Project or in Dave Bingham's new guidebook. If you know who made the first, let us know.
content.protection: Gear .4-#3. Nuts. Draws and a couple runners to manage rope drag.
content.location: Same start as Fool Value, but traverse left in the crack system with the tree behind you (it doesn't affect your movement but blocks the view of the crux from some angles on the ground).

content.description: Start up a clean fun looking arete.  Follow the arete until it eases up, move onto the face and to the same anchors for the first pitch of Eagle Eyes.  Take the second pitch of Eagle Eyes to the summit.  easy to link as 1 long pitch.
content.location: East arete.  walk around to the east face, this will be the obvious line up the arete.

content.description: Start at flake and climb up the flake/shallow right facing corner until you can move left under a small overlap.  Continue through the overlap on the left side and crimp up small edges to gain a blunt arete.  Eventually the angle eases and bigger holds appear.  The climbing continues up a pleasant slab to the anchors.  Thanks goes to Brad Shilling for gifting this FA to Chris and I and for his initial cleaning of moss and lichen on this line.
content.location: About 70 feet right of Jolly Rancher. Start near a tree on the north side/arete of the Eagle Rock and locate a right facing flake/corner.

content.description: Start at base of right-angling crack/flake.Â Follow crack right to end, and then left up face to ridge, following bolts. Cams for supplemental pro in cracks on face and ridge. Ends at shared anchor with Corona. Crux on lower crack.
content.protection: Small to medium cams (to #2) and nuts, and 3 bolts. Two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: East side of Eagle Grove Rock, below first bolt for Lollypop Lambchop.

content.description: Start up a corner on the North West side.  Few tricky moves low sees you to a fun chimney and up a face.  Keep cutting left around a corner to the north east face and a chain anchor.  Second pitch takes the north face/arete up a fun bolted slab and another chain anchor
content.protection:
single rack and slings for first pitch

6 quickdraws for the second
content.location: start in the North West corner

content.description: Start up a slab to clip 1st bolt. Crux is passing 1st bolt, which seemed at least 5.8, maybe 5.9. (5.6 rating preserved from Bingham 2016 guidebook.) Easy scrambling after 2nd bolt.
content.location: East side of Eagle Grove Rock.
